awards.title: Chidsey Leadership Fellow
awards.description:
The Leadership Fellows Program brings together 16 students from each class year to expand their capacity for leadership, learn from one another, and to apply their learning at Davidson and beyond.
Students are engaged in an experienced-based curriculum that builds self-awareness, increases their abilities to address complex problems, builds meaningful relationships, and encourages action.

awards.title: STEM Stars Greece
awards.description:
Project title: "Project Mercury: Measuring Simple Impact Craters on the Innermost Planet"
Among the 17 finalists on the STEM Stars Greece Competition. The 2 winners of the final were going to present their projects on the International Science and Engineering Fair (ISEF) in May 2020 in Anaheim, California. Because of the coronavirus outbreak, the STEM Stars Greece final was cancelled and this year's finalists will participate with the same projects on next year's final.

contributors.headline: Undergraduate student at Davidson College | Gender & Sexuality Studies Research Assistant, Library Research Consultant

projects.title: In A World Without Prisons: A colouring book on prison abolition in the United States
projects.description:
What you have in your hands is (kind of) a colouring book about prison abolition in the United States. It was created as the final project for a semester-long course in the Africana Studies Department at Davidson College titled AFR222: #AbolishThePolice.
This colouring book includes, among other topics, the history of prison abolition, the Prison-Industrial Complex in the US, and famous abolitionists and abolitionist organisations. Material from the course as well as other writings were used for the completion of this project, and they are all mentioned in the Bibliography section at the end of the colouring book.
The images included in the book are not originally mine but were digitally drawn by me in order to be used for the project.

profile_positions.description:
I currently work as one of 8 student Research Consultants at Davidson College's library. Through my work as a research assistant and the courses I took over my forst year in college, I became more interested in research and tis different components. I applied to be a Research Consultant as a way to keep developing my own research skills and knowledge and also help other students become more confident and knowledgable researchers.

As a Research Consultant, I:
• Provide one-on-one research assistance to students through scheduled and drop-in consultations
• Work alongside Library staff, Technology & Innovation staff, and fellow student employees at the Information Desk to assist library patrons with using the library and conducting research
• Develop research skills and learn how to effectively teach and guide students in becoming creative and intentional researchers and scholars
profile_positions.title: Research Consultant

profile_positions.description:
My first semester (first day really) in college, I started working as a research assistant for Dr Melissa Gonzalez, the Gender & Sexuality Studies Department Chair.

My work with her involves a variety of tasks, some of which include:
• Timely completing tasks given by supervisor, including assistance with research, document editing, creation of promotional material for the department, social media management, and general office support
• Creating a collection of images and information organised in the form of a timeline intended to help those studying histories and theories of gender and sexuality to visualise them chronologically, across (relatively) recent history, centered on the West
• During the 2021-2022 Academic Year, I worked with a Gedner & Sexuality Studies major to edit and subtitle videos for their thesis
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
• Met with students weekly and went over material discussed in class that week
• Prepared notes and other material to assist students in understanding the content taught in class
• Assisted students with assignments (e.g. essays) for class, including going over theoretical contexts, and essay outlining and editing
profile_positions.title: Africana Studies Tutor

company.name: Hellenic American Educational Foundation Athens College - Psychico College

profile_positions.company: Hellenic American Educational Foundation Athens College - Psychico College
profile_positions.description:
Athens College Library is the largest school library in Greece, with over 100,000 Greek and foreign volumes. During the summer of 2019, the Athens College Library reorganised its cataloguing system and rearranged all of the main floor selves.

As an intern during that summer, my responsibilities included:
• Organising part of the library (around 8,000 volumes) including rearranging shelves, relabelling books, and cataloging them
• Providing assistance to students and staff at the information desk
profile_positions.title: Library Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Athens College offers 9th-12th grade students the unique opportunity of interning at a company over the summer at a variety of departments, ranging from construction to telecommunications to business operations. This opportunity is possible due to the generosity of parents and friends of the College that work or own these comapnies.

I interned at Aegean Airlines, the flag carrier airline of Greece and the largest Greek airline, as a Business Operations Intern. This learning and groowth opportunity offered me a chance to:
• Observe how the different departments (e.g. delays, financing, programming, schedule-making, engineering, flight attending) operate
• Attend the weekly meeting where the flight delays of the previous day are discussed and justified
• Interact and network with employees from multiple departments and disciplines
profile_positions.title: Intern

volunteer_experiences.description:
The European Youth Parliament (EYP) is a peer-to-peer educational programme that brings together young people from across Europe to debate the pressing issues of our time. EYP's mission is to inspire and empower a young generation of informed, open-minded, responsible, and active citizens that shape society and drive impact.

I have participated in multiple regional, national, and international conferences in the roles of Delegate, Chairperson, Juror, Organiser, Core Organiser, and Vice President.

• Organise multiple regional, national, and international conferences with more than 100 participants each 
• Oversee multiple organising and academic teams during different conferences and facilitate inter-team collaboration
• Conduct research in various fields (e.g. human rights, transgender rights, digital education, transportation) in order to write Academic Guides
• Design digital guides using Canva, a graphic design platform
• Provide technical and emotional support to participants
• Promote the conferences through social media and succeed in increasing event participation

• Cultivated and supported the school’s sports activities both within the College and outside

volunteer_experiences.description:
Hosted by Athens College and in cooperation with The HOME Project, School Project is a volunteer tutoring program. 

• Tutored unaccompanied refugees from the HOME Project in English, Math, and Greek 
• Formulated close friendships and expanded cultural knowledge

Lula Bell's is a resource center for students at Davidson College. The center offers a variety of resources available for any current student who needs them (like food and hygiene products, business and winter clothing, and school supplies). Programming in the space focuses on life skills for all students on topics ranging from financial literacy to systemic social issues.
